body_html:
Using tf.IndexedSlices in optimizers is already a pattern to handle sparse gradients -- for example, see the gradient of tf.gather(). I suspect the issue with tf.unique() not sorting can be resolved by either (1) using some other combination of existing ops, or (2) writing your own op/kernel to handle the desired.

Closing this for now. If you have further questions (not bugs), I suspect StackOverflow will yield more promptly answers.

Using `tf.IndexedSlices` in optimizers is already a pattern to handle sparse gradients -- for example, see the gradient of `tf.gather()`.  I suspect the issue with `tf.unique()` not sorting can be resolved by either (1) using some other combination of existing ops, or (2) writing your own op/kernel to handle the desired.

Closing this for now.  If you have further questions (not bugs), I suspect StackOverflow will yield more promptly answers.
